title: People complain too much about assassin's
body:
Winrates of assassin's

Shaco 53.45%
Zed 50.32%
Nocturne 52.43%
Talon 52.97%
Akali 52.83%

Rengar, Leblanc and Katarina are the only assassin's who need buffs right now because Rengar is sitting at a 48.94% winrate, Leblanc at a 48.46% and Katarina at a 49.48%. Every other assassin is in a good spot and they are receiving uncessary buffs. 

And yet people are complaining how the majority of the assassin class is bad (like always), but the assassin's who are actually good are being buffed. Zed for example, he has been buffed twise now, once on live where his R cooldown has been reduced and second time on PBE where his overall damage is being increased.

I know that there are particular assassin's who need to be buffed because they either have a old kit {{champion:56}} or they are just underperforming with their reworked kit {{champion:7}}.

Just why?

replies.body:
I hate assassin circle jerking as much as you, and i try to speak out against all these people exaggerating.
But these buffs are to compensate for a pretty big duskblade nerf, so they try to fix a problem before it surfaces.

Lb is getting reverted, kat got overnerfed but was the best assassin couple patches ago, renger got reverted, assassin are still some of the most popular champs in the game, they really are whining way too much.
So it's not OK for assassins to oneshot ADC? But it's totally balanced for ADC's to oneshot everyone from range, with freaking right click.

I want you to actually give proof that an ADC one shoted someone with one "freaking right click".

In addition when you refer to ADC's being able to one shot you, I want you to prove to me how {{champion:22}} {{champion:96}} {{champion:429}} one shot you when they deal damage over time with their on-hit playstyle rather than instantly.

He's talking about Veigar "ADC" at 4 hours in with a Nashor's tooth. Or Thresh ADC with three billion souls.

Because that's honestly the only way to kill someone with just a right click. As anyone in the game. No actual marksman can do that anymore. Kindred *could*, at 8000 stacks, one-shot everyone and everything in the game, including a max armor Thresh (Which gives 99.99% physical damage reduction). But everything else is at least a right-click+something else.

He's probably talking about a 200 cs 8+ kill Xayah who autoed him 3 times for a nearly instant kill. 

Because when you let some get really fed, they deal a lot of damage 
*mind blown*
Same goes for assassins...

Show me where an assassin 1 shots someone with your definition of literal 1 shot (thus 1 action, not their whole combo)

ADC's can kill champs in less than 2 seconds with 2-3 attacks.

Here you go: https://streamable.com/c3pc6

{{champion:141}} + {{summoner:4}} + AA = Instant one shot.
{{champion:107}} + R (basic attack) = Another simple one shot.
{{champion:55}} + one passive dagger + E = Does the same damage of the adc's total health.
{{champion:107}} + R (basic attack) = Another rengar one shot (even QT had no reaction because it's just a thing).
{{champion:59}} + {{summoner:4}} + R + AA = Instant one shot. (He couldn't even make use of the damage of his Q and E because varus died that fast).

***

Quick Note: The video is not mine, as well as music, I collected these clips from youtube moments videos.

Ye all of them being ungodly fed.

ADC's do the same (well in 2hits but same amount of counterplay) when being that fed

If you consider them being "ungodly fed" by having 5 extra kills than the ADC then you need to reconsider what being fed really is. You also asked me for evidence where assassins literally did one Auto or one ability to one shot and I gave you the evidence, if you choose to continuesly deny that they are balanced than that's your choice.
I don't have the proof but I had sdraven take sona  from 85% to 0 with 1 axe very rare not common but in this situation it was still a surprise
I can agree with ashe and kalista, but kog has stupid damage, especially with an ardent support+ rage blade

High dps with on hit build =/= one shot.

I understand more the burst complains about crit adcs with Shyv+RFC range+IE when they are feed or on lategame.
In my experience he deals a touch less damage than twitch with ulti up which is at the point I consider burst

While I do agree Assassins are in a good spot, I disagree about Katarina getting buffed , her winrate is 50%+ which is decent
As for Rengar , he is in a weird Situation,  he 1 shoots any adc before Lulu can be able to use her w or her whole kit  , he can go to backline and kill both adc and support and die which wins the fight , why does he need buffs ? Why his winrate is low ? I don't get it, probably people aren't using him as an assassin , to be an assassin , it's about to kill someone without letting them notice you , like hiding in  a bush and 100-0 squishies insted of starting a 5 vs 5 fight by going with a Zed ult the adc in front of 5 people so the adc flashes away and Zed either died or run with his shadow , so how is that even close of being assassination?

Could most likely be because Rengar is the ultimate feast or famine champion in the game.
Doing poorly? Enjoy being handicapped with less AD.
Doing good? You'll snowball like crazy because of 25% extra bonus AD

Only mains that know how to secure their early game with Rengar win more than 50% of their games.

Honestly seems like a poor mechanic to have on a champion...

I guess it fits his theme though.

You see when Rengar got revert he lost a lot of his AoE (Area of Effect) Damage that he had with his previous Q. He could damage multiple enemies with his empowered Q, and now his current Q is limited to one target. Picture this kind of senario, Rengar dives someone with his R and uses Q and the rest of the surrounding enemy team is around the target and they will all just kill you because you couldn't kill any other target near the main target (I hope that kinda makes sense).

Even his early clear is really bad right now without having {{item:3077}}.

> [{quoted}](name=Darkin Hybrid,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=BaMPsgwm,comment-id=00060000,timestamp=2018-03-10T13:22:57.963+0000)
>
> You see when Rengar got revert he lost a lot of his AoE (Area of Effect) Damage that he had with his previous Q. He could damage multiple enemies with his empowered Q, and now his current Q is limited to one target. Picture this kind of senario, Rengar dives someone with his R and uses Q and the rest of the surrounding enemy team is around the target and they will all just kill you because you couldn't kill any other target near the main target (I hope that kinda makes sense).
> 
> Even his early clear is really bad right now without having {{item:3077}}.

Ah that makes sense , I don't play Rengar but I thought of that , his old Q was AoE and it was strong , why did they revert it ? why did people ask to revert knowing it will put him in a bad spot ? he still isn't in a bad spot imo

Because most Rengar mains, like I was before his Rework (not revert), played him because he was fun to play and kind of unique. The rework made his Q unfun to use while basically doing the same thing. We didn't want the revert for stats or winrate, we wanted it because the old Q was the biggest reason to main rengar for most rengar mains back then. It was just a FeelsGoodMan everytime you Qd anything. But even now, the reverted Q has this little delay in terms of Q into empowered Q and it feels clunky. A complete revert (Even Ult, W, E) would've been better.

Because people don't like to be 1 shot.

Frankly they do accept being perma pushed/zoned by Anivia or Sion poking/clearing the wave instantly while poking you down and there is nothing you can do about it.

People think Assassins are bad but they have one of the most healthy playstyles in this game.

> [{quoted}](name=superfire444,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=BaMPsgwm,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-03-10T10:11:09.862+0000)
>
> Because people don't like to be 1 shot.
> 
> Frankly they do accept being perma pushed/zoned by Anivia or Sion poking/clearing the wave instantly while poking you down and there is nothing you can do about it.
> 
> People think Assassins are bad but they have one of the most healthy playstyles in this game.

yeah k6 so healthy. Goes from his blue buff to botlane stealthed and one shots you with just duskblade.

First of all I didn't mention anything specific about champions. Just that the assassin play-style is one of the most healthy. 

Secondly, I'd rather deal with kha'zix who only 1-shots if far ahead than with {{champion:34}} {{champion:14}} {{champion:45}} {{champion:1}} {{champion:90}} (and i can name more). Those playstyles just are not fun **all game** long.
So having to look at grey screen most of the game is more fun then being poked by someone like {{champion:14}}?

Except you don't have to look at a grey screen most of the game. And yes Khazix has more counterplay than the insane poke and CC a sion has. Let alone his tankiness so you can't do anything in lane if you're the wrong champ.
Exactly. You don't have to look at one most of the game. You can always look *away* from the game!

Thats really weird. How can anivia, sion and veigar can infuriate you. All 3 of them have aspects that you can play around and well counterplay them.  All 3 of them are immobile and they have telegraphed spells.  I mean yeah sure sion on lane is kinda annoying (especially if he goes ap and you are squishy) but other than that he is pretty cool.

> All 3 of them have aspects that you can play around and well counterplay them

Not really...

> All 3 of them are immobile and they have telegraphed spells

Being immobile doesn't mean they aren't too strong... they have plenty of peel or ways to deal with being immobile. Also their spells may be telegraphed but if you somehow get caught you're fucked.

> Not really...

How so? Anivia : dodge q, w completely useless against dashes/blinks, e low damage unless hit by q or r(even then it needs to fully charge to deal full damage), r  deals sustained damage coupled with the medium range and the fact that hard cc cancels it makes it balanced. 

Sion: dodge q and telegraphed as fk, w destroy it and he loses a big portion of his damage, e usually is an oke when it enhances itself is when it becomes quite a problem but even then you can still dodge it, r unless you are already cced you are only going to get slowed by it. 

Veigar: dodge q, unless you are cced or slowed its your fault if you get hit by his w, e pretty easy to avoid if you move constantly and is useless against blinks and vlad's pool ( he completely bypasses it with his pool),  r yes point and click and yes it deals damage but its an execute dont stand close to him when you are low on hp. 

> Being immobile doesn't mean they aren't too strong... they have plenty of peel or ways to deal with being immobile. Also their spells may be telegraphed but if you somehow get caught you're fucked.

Not really usually they have one single spell that can be used to peel for themselves. And yeah OFC you will be fucked if you get caught. Thats what you get if you fail abusing their telegraphed spells.

Same goes for Zoe really... Just dodge

Wonder why boards threw such a tantrum about her?

Indeed BUT, there is a big BUT here. She has WAY LESS COOLDOWN THAN THEM (mostly), she deals a bit of true damage, she is quite slippery, her e is one of the best selfpeeling tools in the game (gradually slowing and then sleep which stops dashes in the proccess), she can (or rather could) literally one shot and dont get me started on her w.  Thats why boards was so angry with her.
Not sure who you're talking about? Zoe or Anivia? (if her E would be Q/W/R)
You cant be serious now. Does anivia has sleep?

Glad you understood my point...

They are pretty much the same in the counterplay division.

*facepalm* There is a key difference. Anivia is also prone to ganks. Zoe is not. Her bubble is way strong (against a single target that is) than anivias aoe stun.  + the fact she (zoe) has a movement speed buff. And dont get me started on her passive part of her w.

Anivia can also wall off the other person, so she can impede 2 while Zoe can only impede 1.  Yet somehow you believe Anivia is more prone to ganks than Zoe.

You do realize Zoe has to go past where the minions are to grap dropped summoners/item actives, right?  If she doesn't do that, she doesn't have her W (unless the enemy hands her summoners).  If she does, that's a great opportunity to gank her as she's way out of position.

How is she slippery?  Her only real mobility is if you give her summoner spells/item actives for a movement speed boost.  That is literally her only real mobility.  Her E is also far more telegraphed than other cc such as Lux Q, and many other mages have at least 2 ccs in their kit (anivia even has a wall).  I fail to see how she's more slippery than other champions without you handing her her W.

Also while her cooldowns are generally lower, she deals less aoe damage, has no aoe cc, and her cc is interrupted by damage.

She also doesn't one-shot unless super fed, she at least needs to land E and have her Q land directly on that champion from good distance.

She also doesn't have great waveclear and can't deal well with being pushed in as her waveclear is even worse when she has to stand close to the minions.

> How is she slippery? Her only real mobility is if you give her summoner spells/item actives for a movement speed boost

Well her ulti also counts towards her slipperiness (shit this word exists?!). Good l ccing her if she knows how to use it.  And also while her w gives speed boost you have to keep in mind that its pretty strong for a boost, for up to 70% bonus. + the fact that she might gain a flash or ghost from a minion.  Anyway she is far more mobile/slippery than most burst mages. 

>   Her E is also far more telegraphed than other cc such as Lux Q, and many other mages have at least 2 ccs in their kit 

Indeed it is, but who cares when you can shoot it through a damn wall to increase its speed and range. Also she has 2 cc in her kit too. Her drowsy slows and then they fall asleep. 

> I fail to see how she's more slippery than other champions without you handing her her W.

Oke here is an example to see it. Imagine you are a xerath, and you can finish zoe that is literally 10 hp. But you have only the last shot in your ulti. Killing her is well kinda impossible. If the target was, lets say velkoz, the chances would be better. 

>  Also while her cooldowns are generally lower, she deals less aoe damage,

Well duh. She is an burst mage. Burst mages excel at single target damage. 

>   and her cc is interrupted by damage.

And that said cc can interrupt more or less everything, for channeling to dashes. Also the instance of damage that awakes the target takes bonus damage. And lastly, if those werent enough, the target will take bonus damage even he got awake. (go test it the target will take bonus damage, but you have to be very fast bugsftw)

>  he at least needs to land E and have her Q land directly on that champion from good distance.

Which in theory sounds difficult. But not in practice.  Even heavily armoured tanks will take a decent amount of damage from a single q if it travels a certain distance. 

>  She also doesn't have great waveclear

And again some burst mages have weaker waveclear than other mages. Its just how they work. For instance lux (another burst mage) cant waveclear as good as lets say ziggs.

Her ulti doesn't actually move her.  It **_can_** help her dodge 1 thing, but also guarantees getting hit by the next.

If you're kiting, I doubt you'll be throwing her E through walls.

Other burst mages have significantly better aoe damage. {{champion:1}} {{champion:99}} {{champion:61}} {{champion:134}} {{champion:161}} {{champion:101}} {{champion:45}} {{champion:112}} 

All of these also have at least as much cc as Zoe does.

If there is at least one more enemy nearby, they can block Zoe's Q from whoever she lands E on, and if they're smart, they'll stand closer to the Zoe, making the Q not do as much damage.  Cleanse effects also prevent the sleep effect now.

You also claim she can interrupt anything with her E?  That is true, but the interrupt doesn't happen until 2 seconds after hitting them with E, so it's up to them whether they're interrupted.

> Her ulti doesn't actually move her. It can help her dodge 1 thing, but also guarantees getting hit by the next.

You dont have to actually move ( in the meaning of dashes move) in order to be slippery. And yeah you are right it helps dodge 1 thing. But what if you only have one shot? 

>  If you're kiting, I doubt you'll be throwing her E through walls. 

You do know that it doesnt need a wall for it to be dangerous. The base range still remains dangerous when you are chasing her. 

>  Other burst mages have significantly better aoe damage. 

Well GEEE its almost as if she sacrifices aoe damage in favour of heavily single target damage. 

>  All of these also have at least as much cc as Zoe does.

True but sleep is one of the strongest types of hard cc.   In the ones that you listed, the only ones that can actually cc as much time as zoe or/and stop dashes, is orianna, syndra, velkoz, veigar and theoretically viktor.   Veigar is the only that that can disable the enemy for longer than zoe BUT he has to rank it up, while zoe has to just to take the skill. 

>   If there is at least one more enemy nearby, they can block Zoe's Q from whoever she lands E on, and if they're smart, they'll stand closer to the Zoe, making the Q not do as much damage

And i quote from my previous post, " Which in theory sounds difficult. But not in practice. Even heavily armoured tanks will take a decent amount of damage from a single q if it travels a certain distance" (provided the are the same exp/item since you cant invest too much into mr since the enemy has an adc)

>  You also claim she can interrupt anything with her E? That is true, but the interrupt doesn't happen until 2 seconds after hitting them with E, so it's up to them whether they're interrupted.

2.2 to be precise but yeah. And still imagine being drowsy and  yeah you know that dashing away wont save you in time (either because the dash is long and you will fall asleep mid air or its short and you end up falling asleep anyway).

Your reply when I pointed out how telegraphed Zoe's E is was that it moves faster and further through walls.

People with dashes can get away from Zoe during the sleep duration (unless Zoe has a flash or 2).  Even Zac (with the longest wait for his dash) can move a good distance in time.

Honestly you act as though as soon as Zoe hits you with her E you're dead.  Yet there is so much people can do in that drowsy duration.  They can hide behind minions or allies, hit Zoe back (it does not help much against dives), shield themselves, dash/blink away (they can all manage this before the sleep kicks in, stop exaggerating), they can cleanse it from the start with any item, ability, or summoner that removes cc ({{summoner:1}} {{item:3140}} {{item:3222}}), or allies can just body block it.  All that in addition to being able to dodge the ability in the first place.

Also she's going completely unbanned in many of your games and still isn't picked.  This shows 2 things.  1: You don't consider her worth banning, which asks the question as to why you dislike her so much.  2: She isn't being picked much despite not being banned in these games, which suggests people in general don't think she's so op anymore.

She has plenty of weaknesses and counterplay (not to mention counterpicks), so I don't see what you have to complain so much about this champion.

> [{quoted}](name=Hayaishi,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=BaMPsgwm,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2018-03-10T10:36:40.485+0000)
>
> yeah k6 so healthy. Goes from his blue buff to botlane stealthed and one shots you with just duskblade.

From a Kha'Zix main I agree he is strong right now and his Evolved R needs a nerf.
And Duskblade has needed a nerf for a while (which it's getting finally).
But you're overexaggerating on his stealth abilities and just look like a child because of it. 
You can't even make it from your bot Tri Brush to the river brush or middle of bot Lane (where the laners would be) while stealthed.
While it may not be super smart, couldn't you get the tri bush stealth, use R, reach river brush for stealth, and walk into lane (maybe using one more R)?

> [{quoted}](name=Votable Jester,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=BaMPsgwm,comment-id=0000000000030000,timestamp=2018-03-10T20:17:25.418+0000)
>
> While it may not be super smart, couldn't you get the tri bush stealth, use R, reach river brush for stealth, and walk into lane (maybe using one more R)?

Yeah you're right.

> [{quoted}](name=Hayaishi,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=BaMPsgwm,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2018-03-10T10:36:40.485+0000)
>
> yeah k6 so healthy. Goes from his blue buff to botlane stealthed and one shots you with just duskblade.

That's a problem with Kha'zix, not assassins in general. One outlier isn't the whole class.
K6 is an abomination of a champion, but he does not represent the whole assassin class man...

> [{quoted}](name=Hayaishi,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=BaMPsgwm,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2018-03-10T10:36:40.485+0000)
>
> yeah k6 so healthy. Goes from his blue buff to botlane stealthed and one shots you with just duskblade.

K6?
{{champion:121}}

> [{quoted}](name=Ayzev,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=BaMPsgwm,comment-id=0000000000040000,timestamp=2018-03-10T21:47:54.143+0000)
>
> {{champion:121}}

Oh ok. Yeah fuck his stealth hopping.
They are getting buffed because duskbalde is getting nerfed.
